page.title: 14VIVIAN SYMONS
page.content: In 1951 the Rev. Vivian Symons M.A. became the curate of Biggin Hill. The Church of St. Mark was then a corrugated iron structure, affectionately known as "The Tin Tabernacle". As this was not regarded by the Church authorities as a permanent building it had never been consecrated, so the area was a Â£Peal District' not a parish. The incumbent could only be licensed as a Â£Perpetual Curate' not inducted as a vicar. The community was growing rapidly and there was a need for a permanent church. In London were bomb damaged churches everywhere. Mr.Symons carried all the materials back to his site. It took him three and a half years to achieve his aim and the Church is still standing.
